snippet: Sellers in a hurry to close deals before new tax laws kicked in drove up sales by as much as 40 percent, though inventory continued to fall, leading many to predict higher prices in 2013.
abstract: Late rush in Manhattan home sales brings 2012 to a robust close, with numbers of sales rising by as much as 40 percent in the last three months of the year; inventory continues to fall, leading many to predict higher housing prices in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Sellers in a hurry to close deals before new tax laws kicked in drove up sales by as much as 40 percent, though inventory continued to fall, leading many to predict higher prices in 2013.

headline.seo: Late Rush in Manhattan Home Sales Brings 2012 to a Robust Close
headline.main: Manhattan’s Housing Market Ends 2012 With a Sales Rush
headline.print_headline: Manhattan’s Housing Market Ends 2012 With a Sales Rush
